    preprocessing package¶

    Submodules¶

    preprocessing.custom_transformers module¶

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.CategoricalPreprocessor(columns)¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Encodes categorical features using One-Hot Encoding.

    Parameters:

    columns (List[str]) –

    columns¶

    List of categorical columns to encode.

    Type:

    List[str]

    encoder¶

    Fitted OneHotEncoder instance.

    Type:

    OneHotEncoder

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits the OneHotEncoder to the specified categorical columns.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Optional target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted preprocessor.

    Return type:

    CategoricalPreprocessor

    transform(X)¶

    Transforms the input DataFrame by encoding the specified categorical columns.

    Parameters:

    X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    Returns:

    DataFrame with encoded categorical features.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.ColumnExtractor(cols)¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Extracts specified columns from a pandas DataFrame.

    This transformer selects a subset of columns from the input DataFrame based on the provided list.

    Parameters:

    cols (List[str]) –

    cols¶

    List of column names to extract.

    Type:

    List[str]

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits the transformer. This is a stateless transformer, so it simply returns itself.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Optional target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted transformer.

    Return type:

    ColumnExtractor

    transform(X)¶

    Transforms the input DataFrame by selecting the specified columns.

    Parameters:

    X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing only the selected columns.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.DFFeatureUnion(transformer_list)¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Combines multiple feature transformers into a single transformer that operates on pandas DataFrames.

    This is similar to sklearn’s FeatureUnion but tailored for pandas DataFrames, allowing for merging of transformed DataFrames based on their indices.

    Parameters:

    transformer_list (List[Tuple[str, TransformerMixin]]) –

    transformer_list¶

    List of (name, transformer) tuples.

    Type:

    List[Tuple[str, TransformerMixin]]

    columns¶

    List of column names after transformation.

    Type:

    List[str]

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits all transformers in the transformer list.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Optional target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted transformer.

    Return type:

    DFFeatureUnion

    get_feature_names()¶

    Retrieves the combined feature names after transformation.

    Returns:

    List of feature names.

    Return type:

    List[str]

    transform(X)¶

    Transforms the input DataFrame using all transformers and merges the results.

    Parameters:

    X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    Returns:

    Merged DataFrame containing all transformed features.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.DFRecursiveFeatureSelector(estimator=DecisionTreeRegressor(), n_features=10, step=10)¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Selects a subset of features based on Recursive Feature Elimination (RFE).

    Parameters:

    • n_features (int) –

    • step (int) –

    estimator¶

    The estimator used for feature selection.

    Type:

    DecisionTreeRegressor

    n_features¶

    Number of features to select.

    Type:

    int

    step¶

    Number of features to remove at each iteration.

    Type:

    int

    RFE¶

    The fitted RFE instance after fitting.

    Type:

    RFE

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits the RFE selector to the data.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted feature selector.

    Return type:

    DFRecursiveFeatureSelector

    Return type:

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.DF_RFECV_FeatureSelection(estimator=DecisionTreeRegressor(), cv=StratifiedKFold(n_splits=3, random_state=None, shuffle=False), step=1, scoring='r2')¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Selects a subset of features based on Recursive Feature Elimination with Cross-Validation (RFECV).

    Parameters:

    • cv (StratifiedKFold) –

    • step (int) –

    • scoring (str) –

    Type:

    cv¶

    Cross-validation strategy.

    Type:

    step¶

    Number of features to remove at each step.

    Type:

    int

    scoring¶

    Type:

    str

    RFECV

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.LongTermNormalizer¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Normalizes long-term numeric features using standard scaling.

    In BACKTEST mode, it fits the scaler and stores the parameters. In LIVE mode, it loads the stored parameters to apply normalization.

    ss¶

    StandardScaler instance.

    Type:

    Optional[StandardScaler]

    mean_¶

    Mean values for each feature.

    Type:

    Optional[pd.Series]

    scale_¶

    Scale (standard deviation) values for each feature.

    Type:

    Optional[pd.Series]

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits the StandardScaler to the input data and stores the mean and scale.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Optional target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted transformer.

    Return type:

    LongTermNormalizer

    get_params()¶

    Retrieves the stored normalization parameters.

    Returns:

    Dictionary containing mean and std for each column.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    transform(X)¶

    Transforms the input DataFrame by applying standard scaling.

    Parameters:

    X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    Returns:

    Scaled DataFrame.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    class src.preprocessing.custom_transformers.ShortTermNormalizer(look_back_days=5)¶

    Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

    Normalizes short-term numeric features using rolling mean and standard deviation.

    In BACKTEST mode, it calculates and stores the rolling mean and std. In LIVE mode, it loads the stored parameters to apply normalization.

    Parameters:

    look_back_days (int) –

    look_back_period¶

    Number of periods to look back for rolling calculations.

    Type:

    int

    params¶

    Stored mean and std for each column.

    Type:

    Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]

    columns¶

    List of column names to normalize.

    Type:

    List[str]

    param_dict¶

    Dictionary to store parameters for persistence.

    Type:

    Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]

    fit(X, y=None)¶

    Fits the transformer by calculating rolling mean and std for each column.

    Parameters:

    • X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    • y (Optional[pd.Series]) – Optional target variable.

    Returns:

    Fitted transformer.

    Return type:

    ShortTermNormalizer

    get_params()¶

    Retrieves the stored normalization parameters.

    Returns:

    Dictionary containing mean and std for each column.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]

    transform(X)¶

    Transforms the input DataFrame by normalizing each column.

    Parameters:

    X (pd.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame.

    Returns:

    Normalized DataFrame.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame
